company.name: Adonis Intelligence
company.tagline: Real-time payer intelligence for revenue cycle optimization

positioning.primaryFocus: Real-time alerts on submitted claims to detect and recover denials
targetMarket: Practices using athenahealth, AdvancedMD, or eClinicalWorks
positioning.valueProposition: Embedded EHR intelligence that alerts you to payer behavior changes the moment claims are submitted

pricing.structure: Variable percentage of denied claims recovered
pricing.transparency: Low - pricing not publicly disclosed, varies by customer
pricing.paymentTiming: Monthly billing based on recovery performance
notes: ROI-dependent model can be unpredictable for budgeting

realTimeAlerts.description: Alerts trigger when claims are submitted and payer behavior changes detected

earlyWarningDetection.description: Limited proactive detection - primarily reactive to submitted claims

behavioralDriftTracking.description: Focuses on claim-level alerts, not longitudinal behavioral trends

specialtySpecificRules.description: General rules across specialties, not tailored for dialysis/ABA/imaging/home health

preSubmissionWarnings.description: Alerts occur after submission, not before

editValidation.description: EHR-embedded edit checking at time of claim creation

ehrSystems.description: Deep integrations with athenahealth, AdvancedMD, eClinicalWorks

clearinghouseIntegration.description: Integrates with major clearinghouses for claim tracking

implementation.setupComplexity: High - IT resources and EHR vendor coordination required
implementation.dataConnectionMethod: EHR API or direct database access

support.accountManagement: Quarterly business reviews for enterprise customers

strengths: Deep EHR integrations with major platforms (athenahealth, AdvancedMD, eCW)
Real-time alerts at point of claim submission
Embedded in existing PM workflows - no separate login
Established player with proven case studies (104% PT denial spike detection)
Strong for practices already on supported EHR platforms
weaknesses: Pricing opacity - percentage of recovery model not transparent
Limited specialty-specific intelligence (no dialysis ESRD PPS, ABA auth tracking, etc.)
Reactive alerts AFTER submission - prevention happens at scrubbing, not behavioral drift detection
High implementation complexity requiring IT resources and EHR vendor coordination
Not ideal for practices with unsupported EHRs or custom PM systems
bestFor: Practices already using athenahealth, AdvancedMD, or eClinicalWorks
General specialty practices (not high-complexity verticals like dialysis/ABA)
Organizations preferring EHR-embedded solutions over standalone tools
Practices with IT resources to support 3-6 month EHR integration projects
notIdealFor: Specialty practices needing dialysis-specific (ESRD PPS), ABA-specific (auth tracking), imaging-specific, or home health-specific intelligence
Organizations requiring transparent fixed pricing for budgeting
Practices wanting prevention BEFORE submission, not just alerts after
customerComplaints: Long implementation timelines due to EHR integration dependencies
Difficulty budgeting due to variable percentage-based pricing
Alerts can be noisy - many false positives requiring manual triage
Limited specialty-specific customization for niche verticals
EHR integration issues can block upgrades or changes to PM workflows

migrationToUpstream.difficulty: Low - Adonis and Upstream can run in parallel
migrationToUpstream.timeline: 30 days for Upstream implementation (independent of Adonis)
migrationToUpstream.dataTransfer: No direct data migration needed - fresh start with Upstream's behavioral analysis
migrationToUpstream.supportOffered: Upstream provides dedicated onboarding to configure specialty-specific rules from day one

caseStudies.title: Physical Therapy Practice - 104% Denial Spike Detection
caseStudies.challenge: Sudden denial rate increase went undetected
caseStudies.solution: Adonis real-time alerts flagged 104% spike in PT denials
caseStudies.outcome: Practice recovered revenue and adjusted coding practices

sources: Sales conversations with prospects evaluating both Adonis and Upstream
Industry analyst reports on RCM technology
